00054 
00055 /** Utility routine used in code that prints out declarations; returns true
00056     if the given name should be printed, false otherwise.  This allows us
00057     to omit the names for various internal things (whose names start with
00058     double underscores) and emit anonymous declarations for them instead.
00059  */
00060 
00061 static bool
00062 lShouldPrintName(const std::string &name) {
00063     if (name.size() == 0)
00064         return false;
00065     else if (name[0] != '_')
00066         return true;
00067     else
00068         return (name.size() == 1) || (name[1] != '_');
00069 }

00075 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformBool = new AtomicType(TYPE_BOOL, true, false);
00076 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingBool = new AtomicType(TYPE_BOOL, false, false);
00077 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT32, true, false);
00078 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT32, false, false);
00079 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformUInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT32, true, false);
00080 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT32, false, false);
00081 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformFloat = new AtomicType(TYPE_FLOAT, true, false);
00082 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingFloat = new AtomicType(TYPE_FLOAT, false, false);
00083 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT64, true, false);
00084 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT64, false, false);
00085 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformUInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT64, true, false);
00086 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingUInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT64, false, false);
00087 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformDouble = new AtomicType(TYPE_DOUBLE, true, false);
00088 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingDouble = new AtomicType(TYPE_DOUBLE, false, false);
00089 
00090 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformConstBool = new AtomicType(TYPE_BOOL, true, true);
00091 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingConstBool = new AtomicType(TYPE_BOOL, false, true);
00092 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformConstInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT32, true, true);
00093 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingConstInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT32, false, true);
00094 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT32, true, true);
00095 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt32 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT32, false, true);
00096 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformConstFloat = new AtomicType(TYPE_FLOAT, true, true);
00097 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingConstFloat = new AtomicType(TYPE_FLOAT, false, true);
00098 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformConstInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT64, true, true);
00099 const AtomicType *AtomicType::VaryingConstInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_INT64, false, true);
00100 const AtomicType *AtomicType::UniformConstUInt64 = new AtomicType(TYPE_UINT64, true, true);

00108     : basicType(bt), isUniform(iu), isConst(ic) {

00118 bool
00119 AtomicType::IsFloatType() const {
00120     return (basicType == TYPE_FLOAT || basicType == TYPE_DOUBLE);

00124 bool
00125 AtomicType::IsIntType() const {
00126     return (basicType == TYPE_INT32 || basicType == TYPE_UINT32 ||
00127             basicType == TYPE_INT64 || basicType == TYPE_UINT64);
00128 }

00131 bool
00132 AtomicType::IsUnsignedType() const {
00133     return (basicType == TYPE_UINT32 || basicType == TYPE_UINT64);
00134 }

00136 
00137 bool
00138 AtomicType::IsBoolType() const {
00139     return basicType == TYPE_BOOL;

00143 bool
00144 AtomicType::IsConstType() const { 
00145     return isConst;

00148 
00149 const AtomicType *
00150 AtomicType::GetAsUnsignedType() const {
00151     if (IsUnsignedType()) 
00152         return this;
00153 
00154     if (this == AtomicType::UniformInt32)           return AtomicType::UniformUInt32;
00155     else if (this == AtomicType::VaryingInt32)      return AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
00156     else if (this == AtomicType::UniformInt64)      return AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
00157     else if (this == AtomicType::VaryingInt64)      return AtomicType::VaryingUInt64;
00158     else if (this == AtomicType::UniformConstInt32) return AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32;
00159     else if (this == AtomicType::VaryingConstInt32) return AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt32;
00160     else if (this == AtomicType::UniformConstInt64) return AtomicType::UniformConstUInt64;
00161     else if (this == AtomicType::VaryingConstInt64) return AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt64;
00162     else                                            return NULL;
00163 }
00164 
00165 
00166 const AtomicType *
00167 AtomicType::GetAsConstType() const {
00168     if (this == AtomicType::Void) 
00169         return this;
00170 
00171     switch (basicType) {
00172     case TYPE_BOOL:    return isUniform ? UniformConstBool   : VaryingConstBool;
00173     case TYPE_INT32:   return isUniform ? UniformConstInt32  : VaryingConstInt32;
00174     case TYPE_UINT32:  return isUniform ? UniformConstUInt32 : VaryingConstUInt32;
00175     case TYPE_FLOAT:   return isUniform ? UniformConstFloat  : VaryingConstFloat;
00176     case TYPE_INT64:   return isUniform ? UniformConstInt64  : VaryingConstInt64;
00177     case TYPE_UINT64:  return isUniform ? UniformConstUInt64 : VaryingConstUInt64;
00178     case TYPE_DOUBLE:  return isUniform ? UniformConstDouble : VaryingConstDouble;
00179     default:
00180         FATAL("logic error in AtomicType::GetAsConstType()");
00181         return NULL;
00182     }
00183 }
00184 
00185 
00186 const AtomicType *
00187 AtomicType::GetAsNonConstType() const {
00188     if (this == AtomicType::Void) 
00189         return this;
00190 
00191     switch (basicType) {
00192     case TYPE_BOOL:    return isUniform ? UniformBool   : VaryingBool;
00193     case TYPE_INT32:   return isUniform ? UniformInt32  : VaryingInt32;
00194     case TYPE_UINT32:  return isUniform ? UniformUInt32 : VaryingUInt32;
00195     case TYPE_FLOAT:   return isUniform ? UniformFloat  : VaryingFloat;
00196     case TYPE_INT64:   return isUniform ? UniformInt64  : VaryingInt64;
00197     case TYPE_UINT64:  return isUniform ? UniformUInt64 : VaryingUInt64;
00198     case TYPE_DOUBLE:  return isUniform ? UniformDouble : VaryingDouble;
00199     default:
00200         FATAL("logic error in AtomicType::GetAsNonConstType()");
00201         return NULL;
00202     }
00203 }

00208     return this;

00211 
00212 const AtomicType *
00213 AtomicType::GetAsVaryingType() const {
00214     if (IsVaryingType()) 
00215         return this;
00216 
00217     switch (basicType) {
00218     case TYPE_VOID:   return this;
00219     case TYPE_BOOL:   return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstBool   : AtomicType::VaryingBool;
00220     case TYPE_INT32:  return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstInt32  : AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
00221     case TYPE_UINT32: return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt32 : AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
00222     case TYPE_FLOAT:  return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstFloat  : AtomicType::VaryingFloat;
00223     case TYPE_INT64:  return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstInt64  : AtomicType::VaryingInt64;
00224     case TYPE_UINT64: return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt64 : AtomicType::VaryingUInt64;
00225     case TYPE_DOUBLE: return isConst ? AtomicType::VaryingConstDouble : AtomicType::VaryingDouble;
00226     default:          FATAL("Logic error in AtomicType::GetAsVaryingType()");
00227     }
00228     return NULL;
00229 }
00230 
00231 
00232 const AtomicType *
00233 AtomicType::GetAsUniformType() const {
00234     if (IsUniformType()) 
00235         return this;
00236 
00237     switch (basicType) {
00238     case TYPE_VOID:   return this;
00239     case TYPE_BOOL:   return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstBool : AtomicType::UniformBool;
00240     case TYPE_INT32:  return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt32;
00241     case TYPE_UINT32: return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32 : AtomicType::UniformUInt32;
00242     case TYPE_FLOAT:  return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstFloat : AtomicType::UniformFloat;
00243     case TYPE_INT64:  return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstInt64 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
00244     case TYPE_UINT64: return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstUInt64 : AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
00245     case TYPE_DOUBLE: return isConst ? AtomicType::UniformConstDouble : AtomicType::UniformDouble;
00246     default:          FATAL("Logic error in AtomicType::GetAsUniformType()");
00247     }
00248     return NULL;
00249 }

00252 const Type *
00253 AtomicType::GetSOAType(int width) const {
00254     assert(width > 0);
00255     return new ArrayType(this, width);
00256 }

00258 
00259 std::string
00260 AtomicType::GetString() const {
00261     std::string ret;
00262     if (basicType != TYPE_VOID) {
00263         if (isConst)   ret += "const ";
00264         if (isUniform) ret += "uniform ";
00265     }
00266 
00267     switch (basicType) {
00268     case TYPE_VOID:   ret += "void";            break;
00269     case TYPE_BOOL:   ret += "bool";            break;
00270     case TYPE_INT32:  ret += "int32";           break;
00271     case TYPE_UINT32: ret += "unsigned int32";  break;
00272     case TYPE_FLOAT:  ret += "float";           break;
00273     case TYPE_INT64:  ret += "int64";           break;
00274     case TYPE_UINT64: ret += "unsigned int64";  break;
00275     case TYPE_DOUBLE: ret += "double";          break;
00276     default: FATAL("Logic error in AtomicType::GetString()");
00277     }
00278     return ret;
00279 }
00280 
00281 
00282 std::string
00283 AtomicType::Mangle() const {
00284     std::string ret;
00285     if (isConst)   ret += "C";
00286     if (isUniform) ret += "U";
00287 
00288     switch (basicType) {
00289     case TYPE_VOID:   ret += "v"; break;
00290     case TYPE_BOOL:   ret += "b"; break;
00291     case TYPE_INT32:  ret += "i"; break;
00292     case TYPE_UINT32: ret += "u"; break;
00293     case TYPE_FLOAT:  ret += "f"; break;
00294     case TYPE_INT64:  ret += "I"; break;
00295     case TYPE_UINT64: ret += "U"; break;
00296     case TYPE_DOUBLE: ret += "d"; break;
00297     default: FATAL("Logic error in AtomicType::Mangle()");
00298     }
00299     return ret;
00300 }
00301 
00302 
00303 std::string
00304 AtomicType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const {
00305     std::string ret;
00306     assert(isUniform);
00307     if (isConst) ret += "const ";
00308 
00309     switch (basicType) {
00310     case TYPE_VOID:   ret += "void";     break;
00311     case TYPE_BOOL:   ret += "bool";     break;
00312     case TYPE_INT32:  ret += "int32_t";  break;
00313     case TYPE_UINT32: ret += "uint32_t"; break;
00314     case TYPE_FLOAT:  ret += "float";    break;
00315     case TYPE_DOUBLE: ret += "double";   break;
00316     case TYPE_INT64:  ret += "int64_t";  break;
00317     case TYPE_UINT64: ret += "uint64_t"; break;
00318     default: FATAL("Logic error in AtomicType::GetCDeclaration()");
00319     }
00320 
00321     if (lShouldPrintName(name)) {
00322         ret += " ";
00323         ret += name;
00324     }
00325     return ret;
00326 }
00327 
00328 
00329 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *
00330 AtomicType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
00331     switch (basicType) {
00332     case TYPE_VOID:
00333         return llvm::Type::getVoidTy(*ctx);
00334     case TYPE_BOOL:
00335         return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::BoolType : LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType;
00336     case TYPE_INT32:
00337     case TYPE_UINT32:
00338         return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type : LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
00339     case TYPE_FLOAT:
00340         return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::FloatType : LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType;
00341     case TYPE_INT64:
00342     case TYPE_UINT64:
00343         return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type : LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
00344     case TYPE_DOUBLE:
00345         return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::DoubleType : LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType;
00346     default:
00347         FATAL("logic error in AtomicType::LLVMType");
00348         return NULL;
00349     }
00350 }
00351 
00352 
00353 llvm::DIType
00354 AtomicType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
00355 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
00356     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
00357     return llvm::DIType();
00358 #else
00359     if (isUniform) {
00360         switch (basicType) {
00361         case TYPE_VOID:
00362             return llvm::DIType();
00363         case TYPE_BOOL:
00364             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("bool", 32 /* size */, 32 /* align */,
00365                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_unsigned);
00366             break;
00367         case TYPE_INT32:
00368             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("int32", 32 /* size */, 32 /* align */,
00369                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_signed);
00370             break;
00371         case TYPE_UINT32:
00372             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("uint32", 32 /* size */, 32 /* align */,
00373                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_unsigned);
00374             break;
00375         case TYPE_FLOAT:
00376             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("float", 32 /* size */, 32 /* align */,
00377                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_float);
00378             break;
00379         case TYPE_DOUBLE:
00380             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("double", 64 /* size */, 64 /* align */,
00381                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_float);
00382             break;
00383         case TYPE_INT64:
00384             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("int64", 64 /* size */, 64 /* align */,
00385                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_signed);
00386             break;
00387         case TYPE_UINT64:
00388             return m->diBuilder->createBasicType("uint64", 64 /* size */, 64 /* align */,
00389                                                  llvm::dwarf::DW_ATE_unsigned);
00390             break;
00391         default:
00392             FATAL("unhandled basic type in AtomicType::GetDIType()");
00393             return llvm::DIType();
00394         }
00395     }
00396     else {
00397         llvm::DIType unifType = GetAsUniformType()->GetDIType(scope);
00398         llvm::Value *sub = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateSubrange(0, g->target.vectorWidth-1);
00399 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
00400         llvm::Value *suba[] = { sub };
00401         llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(suba, 1);
00402 #else
00403         llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(sub);
00404 #endif // LLVM_2_9
00405         uint64_t size =  unifType.getSizeInBits()  * g->target.vectorWidth;
00406         uint64_t align = unifType.getAlignInBits() * g->target.vectorWidth;
00407         return m->diBuilder->createVectorType(size, align, unifType, subArray);
00408     }
00409 #endif // LLVM_2_8
00410 }

00474 EnumType::GetAsVaryingType() const {
00475     if (IsVaryingType())
00476         return this;
00477     else {
00478         EnumType *enumType = new EnumType(*this);
00479         enumType->isUniform = false;
00480         return enumType;

00491         enumType->isUniform = true;
00492         return enumType;

00504 const EnumType *
00505 EnumType::GetAsConstType() const {
00506     if (isConst)
00507         return this;

00515 
00516 const EnumType *
00517 EnumType::GetAsNonConstType() const {
00518     if (!isConst)
00519         return this;
00520     else {
00521         EnumType *enumType = new EnumType(*this);
00522         enumType->isConst = false;
00523         return enumType;
00524     }
00525 }

00527 
00528 std::string 
00529 EnumType::GetString() const {
00530     std::string ret;
00531     if (isConst) ret += "const ";
00532     if (isUniform) ret += "uniform ";
00533     ret += "enum ";
00534     if (name.size())
00535         ret += name;
00536     return ret;
00537 }
00538 
00539 
00540 std::string 
00541 EnumType::Mangle() const {
00542     std::string ret = std::string("enum[") + name + std::string("]");
00543     return ret;
00544 }
00545 
00546 
00547 std::string 
00548 EnumType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &varName) const {
00549     std::string ret;
00550     if (isConst) ret += "const ";
00551     ret += "enum";
00552     if (name.size())
00553         ret += std::string(" ") + name;
00554     if (lShouldPrintName(varName)) {
00555         ret += " ";
00556         ret += varName;
00557     }
00558     return ret;
00559 }

00561 
00562 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *
00563 EnumType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
00564     return isUniform ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type : LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
00565 }
00566 
00567 
00568 llvm::DIType 
00569 EnumType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
00570 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
00571     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
00572     return llvm::DIType();
00573 #else
00574     std::vector<llvm::Value *> enumeratorDescriptors;
00575     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < enumerators.size(); ++i) {
00576         unsigned int enumeratorValue;
00577         assert(enumerators[i]->constValue != NULL);
00578         int count = enumerators[i]->constValue->AsUInt32(&enumeratorValue);
00579         assert(count == 1);
00580 
00581         llvm::Value *descriptor = 
00582             m->diBuilder->createEnumerator(enumerators[i]->name, enumeratorValue);
00583         enumeratorDescriptors.push_back(descriptor);
00584     }
00585     llvm::DIArray elementArray = 
00586         m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(&enumeratorDescriptors[0],
00587                                        enumeratorDescriptors.size());
00588 
00589     llvm::DIFile diFile = pos.GetDIFile();
00590     llvm::DIType diType =
00591         m->diBuilder->createEnumerationType(scope, name, diFile, pos.first_line,
00592                                             32 /* size in bits */,
00593                                             32 /* align in bits */,
00594                                             elementArray);
00595     if (IsUniformType())
00596         return diType;
00597 
00598     llvm::Value *sub = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateSubrange(0, g->target.vectorWidth-1);
00599 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
00600     llvm::Value *suba[] = { sub };
00601     llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(suba, 1);
00602 #else
00603     llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(sub);
00604 #endif // !LLVM_2_9
00605     uint64_t size =  diType.getSizeInBits()  * g->target.vectorWidth;
00606     uint64_t align = diType.getAlignInBits() * g->target.vectorWidth;
00607     return m->diBuilder->createVectorType(size, align, diType, subArray);
00608 #endif // !LLVM_2_8
00609 }

00612 void
00613 EnumType::SetEnumerators(const std::vector<Symbol *> &e) {
00614     enumerators = e;
00615 }
00616 
00617 
00618 int
00619 EnumType::GetEnumeratorCount() const {
00620     return (int)enumerators.size();
00621 }
00622 
00623 
00624 const Symbol *
00625 EnumType::GetEnumerator(int i) const {
00626     return enumerators[i];
00627 }

00634     return GetElementType();

00638 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00639 // ArrayType
00640 
00641 ArrayType::ArrayType(const Type *c, int a) 
00642     : child(c), numElements(a) {
00643     // 0 -> unsized array.
00644     assert(numElements >= 0);
00645 }
00646 
00647 
00648 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *
00649 ArrayType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
00650     if (!child)
00651         return NULL;
00652 
00653     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ct = child->LLVMType(ctx);
00654     if (!ct)
00655         return NULL;
00656     return llvm::ArrayType::get(ct, numElements);
00657 }

00695 
00696 const Type *
00697 ArrayType::GetBaseType() const {
00698     const Type *type = child;
00699     const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
00700     // Keep walking until we reach a child that isn't itself an array
00701     while (at) {
00702         type = at->child;
00703         at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type);
00704     }
00705     return type;
00706 }
00707

00709 const ArrayType *
00710 ArrayType::GetAsVaryingType() const {
00711     return new ArrayType(child->GetAsVaryingType(), numElements);
00712 }

00715 const ArrayType *
00716 ArrayType::GetAsUniformType() const {
00717     return new ArrayType(child->GetAsUniformType(), numElements);
00718 }

00722 ArrayType::GetSOAType(int width) const {
00723     return new ArrayType(child->GetSOAType(width), numElements);
00724 }

00728 ArrayType::GetAsConstType() const {
00729     return new ArrayType(child->GetAsConstType(), numElements);
00730 }

00733 const ArrayType *
00734 ArrayType::GetAsNonConstType() const {
00735     return new ArrayType(child->GetAsNonConstType(), numElements);

00750 
00751 std::string
00752 ArrayType::GetString() const {
00753     std::string s = GetBaseType()->GetString();
00754 
00755     const ArrayType *at = this;
00756     // Walk through this and any children arrays and print all of their
00757     // dimensions
00758     while (at) {
00759         char buf[16];
00760         if (numElements > 0)
00761             sprintf(buf, "%d", at->numElements);
00762         else
00763             buf[0] = '\0';
00764         s += std::string("[") + std::string(buf) + std::string("]");
00765         at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(at->child);
00766     }
00767     return s;
00768 }
00769 
00770 
00771 std::string
00772 ArrayType::Mangle() const {
00773     std::string s = child->Mangle();
00774     char buf[16];
00775     if (numElements > 0)
00776         sprintf(buf, "%d", numElements);
00777     else
00778         buf[0] = '\0';
00779     return s + "[" + buf + "]";
00780 }
00781 
00782 
00783 std::string
00784 ArrayType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const {
00785     std::string s = GetBaseType()->GetCDeclaration(name);
00786 
00787     const ArrayType *at = this;
00788     while (at) {
00789         char buf[16];
00790         if (numElements > 0)
00791             sprintf(buf, "%d", at->numElements);
00792         else
00793             buf[0] = '\0';
00794         s += std::string("[") + std::string(buf) + std::string("]");
00795         at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(at->child);
00796     }
00797     return s;
00798 }
00799 
00800 
00801 int
00802 ArrayType::TotalElementCount() const {
00803     const ArrayType *ct = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(child);
00804     if (ct)
00805         return numElements * ct->TotalElementCount();
00806     else
00807         return numElements;
00808 }
00809 
00810 
00811 llvm::DIType
00812 ArrayType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
00813 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
00814     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
00815     return llvm::DIType();
00816 #else
00817     if (!child)
00818         return llvm::DIType();
00819 
00820     llvm::DIType eltType = child->GetDIType(scope);
00821 
00822     int lowerBound = 0, upperBound = numElements-1;
00823     if (numElements == 0) {
00824         // unsized array -> indicate with low > high
00825         lowerBound = 1;
00826         upperBound = 0;
00827     }
00828 
00829     llvm::Value *sub = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateSubrange(lowerBound, upperBound);
00830     std::vector<llvm::Value *> subs;
00831     subs.push_back(sub);
00832 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
00833     llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(&subs[0], subs.size());
00834 #else
00835     llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(subs);
00836 #endif
00837 
00838     // it's intentional that size is zero for unsized arrays
00839     uint64_t size = eltType.getSizeInBits() * numElements;
00840     uint64_t align = eltType.getAlignInBits();
00841 
00842     return m->diBuilder->createArrayType(size, align, eltType, subArray);
00843 #endif // LLVM_2_8
00844 }
00845 
00846 
00847 ArrayType *
00848 ArrayType::GetSizedArray(int sz) const {
00849     assert(numElements == 0);
00850     return new ArrayType(child, sz);
00851 }

00901 
00902 std::string
00903 SOAArrayType::GetString() const {
00904     std::string s;
00905 
00906     char buf[32];
00907     sprintf(buf, "soa<%d> ", soaWidth);
00908     s += buf;
00909     s += GetBaseType()->GetString();
00910 
00911     const ArrayType *at = this;
00912     while (at) {
00913         char buf[16];
00914         if (numElements > 0)
00915             sprintf(buf, "%d", at->numElements);
00916         else
00917             buf[0] = '\0';
00918         s += std::string("[") + std::string(buf) + std::string("]");
00919         at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(at->child);
00920     }
00921     return s;
00922 }

00938 
00939 int
00940 SOAArrayType::TotalElementCount() const {
00941     int sz = numElements / soaWidth;
00942     const ArrayType *ct = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(child);
00943     if (ct)
00944         return sz * ct->TotalElementCount();
00945     else
00946         return sz;
00947 }

00951 SOAArrayType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
00952     if (!child)
00953         return NULL;
00954 
00955     const ArrayType *a = soaType();
00956     if (!a)
00957         return NULL;
00958     return a->LLVMType(ctx);
00959 }

00966     return llvm::DIType();
00967 #else
00968     if (!child)
00969         return llvm::DIType();

00986 SOAArrayType::soaType() const {
00987     const Type *childSOA = child->GetSOAType(soaWidth);
00988     return new ArrayType(childSOA, numElements / soaWidth);
00989 }

01112 
01113 
01114 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *
01115 VectorType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
01116     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *bt = base->LLVMType(ctx);
01117     if (!bt)
01118         return NULL;
01119 
01120     if (base->IsUniformType())
01121         // vectors of uniform types are laid out across LLVM vectors, with
01122         // the llvm vector size set to be a multiple of the machine's
01123         // natural vector size (e.g. 4 on SSE).  This is a roundabout way
01124         // of ensuring that LLVM lays them out into machine vector
01125         // registers so that e.g. if we want to add two uniform 4 float
01126         // vectors, that is turned into a single addps on SSE.
01127         return llvm::VectorType::get(bt, getVectorMemoryCount());
01128     else
01129         // varying types are already laid out to fill HW vector registers,
01130         // so a vector type here is just expanded out as an llvm array.
01131         return llvm::ArrayType::get(bt, getVectorMemoryCount());
01132 }
01133 
01134 
01135 llvm::DIType
01136 VectorType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
01137 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
01138     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
01139     return llvm::DIType();
01140 #else
01141     llvm::DIType eltType = base->GetDIType(scope);
01142     llvm::Value *sub = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateSubrange(0, numElements-1);
01143 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
01144     llvm::Value *subs[1] = { sub };
01145     llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(subs, 1);
01146 #else
01147     llvm::DIArray subArray = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(sub);
01148 #endif
01149 
01150     uint64_t sizeBits = eltType.getSizeInBits() * numElements;
01151 
01152     // vectors of varying types are already naturally aligned to the
01153     // machine's vector width, but arrays of uniform types need to be
01154     // explicitly aligned to the machines natural vector alignment.
01155     uint64_t align = eltType.getAlignInBits();
01156     if (IsUniformType())
01157         align = 4 * g->target.nativeVectorWidth;
01158 
01159     return m->diBuilder->createVectorType(sizeBits, align, eltType, subArray);
01160 #endif // LLVM_2_8
01161 }
01162 
01163 
01164 int
01165 VectorType::getVectorMemoryCount() const {
01166     if (base->IsVaryingType())
01167         return numElements;
01168     else {
01169         int nativeWidth = g->target.nativeVectorWidth;
01170         if (base->GetAsUniformType() == AtomicType::UniformInt64 ||
01171             base->GetAsUniformType() == AtomicType::UniformUInt64 ||
01172             base->GetAsUniformType() == AtomicType::UniformDouble)
01173             // target.nativeVectorWidth should be in terms of 32-bit
01174             // values, so for the 64-bit guys, it takes half as many of
01175             // them to fill the native width
01176             nativeWidth /= 2;
01177         // and now round up the element count to be a multiple of
01178         // nativeWidth
01179         return (numElements + (nativeWidth - 1)) & ~(nativeWidth-1);
01180     }
01181 }

01249 StructType::GetAsUniformType() const {

01254                               isConst, true, pos);
01255 }
01256 
01257 
01258 const Type *
01259 StructType::GetSOAType(int width) const {
01260     std::vector<const Type *> et;
01261     // The SOA version of a structure is just a structure that holds SOAed
01262     // versions of its elements
01263     for (int i = 0; i < GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01264         const Type *t = GetElementType(i);
01265         et.push_back(t->GetSOAType(width));
01266     }
01267     return new StructType(name, et, elementNames, elementPositions,
01268                           isConst, isUniform, pos);
01269 }
01270 
01271 
01272 const StructType *
01273 StructType::GetAsConstType() const {
01274     if (IsConstType()) 
01275         return this;
01276     else
01277         return new StructType(name, elementTypes, elementNames, 
01278                               elementPositions, true, isUniform, pos);
01279 }
01280 
01281 
01282 const StructType *
01283 StructType::GetAsNonConstType() const {
01284     if (!IsConstType()) 
01285         return this;
01286     else
01287         return new StructType(name, elementTypes, elementNames, elementPositions,
01288                               false, isUniform, pos);
01289 }
01290 
01291 
01292 std::string
01293 StructType::GetString() const {
01294     std::string ret;
01295     if (isConst)   ret += "const ";
01296     if (isUniform) ret += "uniform ";
01297     else           ret += "varying ";
01298 
01299     // Don't print the entire struct declaration, just print the struct's name.
01300     // @todo Do we need a separate method that prints the declaration?
01301 #if 0
01302     ret += std::string("struct { ") + name;
01303     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elementTypes.size(); ++i) {
01304         ret += elementTypes[i]->GetString();
01305         ret += " ";
01306         ret += elementNames[i];
01307         ret += "; ";
01308     }
01309     ret += "}";
01310 #else
01311     ret += "struct ";
01312     ret += name;
01313 #endif
01314     return ret;
01315 }
01316 
01317 
01318 std::string
01319 StructType::Mangle() const {
01320     std::string ret;
01321     ret += "s[";
01322     if (isConst)
01323         ret += "_c_";
01324     if (isUniform)
01325         ret += "_u_";
01326     ret += name + std::string("]<");
01327     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elementTypes.size(); ++i)
01328         ret += elementTypes[i]->Mangle();
01329     ret += ">";
01330     return ret;
01331 }
01332     
01333 
01334 std::string
01335 StructType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &n) const {
01336     std::string ret;
01337     if (isConst) ret += "const ";
01338     ret += std::string("struct ") + name;
01339     if (lShouldPrintName(n))
01340         ret += std::string(" ") + n;
01341     if (!isUniform) {
01342         char buf[16];
01343         sprintf(buf, "[%d]", g->target.vectorWidth);
01344         ret += buf;
01345     }
01346     return ret;
01347 }
01348 
01349 
01350 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *
01351 StructType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
01352     std::vector<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *> llvmTypes;
01353     for (int i = 0; i < GetElementCount(); ++i) {
01354         const Type *type = GetElementType(i);
01355         llvmTypes.push_back(type->LLVMType(ctx));
01356     }
01357     return llvm::StructType::get(*ctx, llvmTypes);
01358 }
01359 
01360 
01361 llvm::DIType
01362 StructType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
01363 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
01364     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
01365     return llvm::DIType();
01366 #else
01367     uint64_t currentSize = 0, align = 0;
01368 
01369     std::vector<llvm::Value *> elementLLVMTypes;
01370     // Walk through the elements of the struct; for each one figure out its
01371     // alignment and size, using that to figure out its offset w.r.t. the
01372     // start of the structure.
01373     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elementTypes.size(); ++i) {
01374         llvm::DIType eltType = GetElementType(i)->GetDIType(scope);
01375         uint64_t eltAlign = eltType.getAlignInBits();
01376         uint64_t eltSize = eltType.getSizeInBits();
01377 
01378         // The alignment for the entire structure is the maximum of the
01379         // required alignments of its elements
01380         align = std::max(align, eltAlign);
01381 
01382         // Move the current size forward if needed so that the current
01383         // element starts at an offset that's the correct alignment.
01384         if (currentSize > 0 && (currentSize % eltAlign))
01385             currentSize += eltAlign - (currentSize % eltAlign);
01386         assert((currentSize == 0) || (currentSize % eltAlign) == 0);
01387 
01388         llvm::DIFile diFile = elementPositions[i].GetDIFile();
01389         int line = elementPositions[i].first_line;
01390 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
01391         llvm::DIType fieldType = 
01392             m->diBuilder->createMemberType(elementNames[i], diFile, line,
01393                                            eltSize, eltAlign, currentSize, 0,
01394                                            eltType);
01395 #else
01396         llvm::DIType fieldType = 
01397             m->diBuilder->createMemberType(scope, elementNames[i], diFile, 
01398                                            line, eltSize, eltAlign, 
01399                                            currentSize, 0, eltType);
01400 #endif // LLVM_2_9
01401         elementLLVMTypes.push_back(fieldType);
01402 
01403         currentSize += eltSize;
01404     }
01405 
01406     // Round up the struct's entire size so that it's a multiple of the
01407     // required alignment that we figured out along the way...
01408     if (currentSize > 0 && (currentSize % align))
01409         currentSize += align - (currentSize % align);
01410 
01411 #ifdef LLVM_2_9
01412     llvm::DIArray elements = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(&elementLLVMTypes[0], 
01413                                                             elementLLVMTypes.size());
01414 #else
01415     llvm::DIArray elements = m->diBuilder->getOrCreateArray(elementLLVMTypes);
01416 #endif
01417     llvm::DIFile diFile = pos.GetDIFile();
01418     return m->diBuilder->createStructType(scope, name, diFile, pos.first_line, currentSize, 
01419                                           align, 0, elements);
01420 #endif // LLVM_2_8
01421 }
01422 
01423 
01424 const Type *
01425 StructType::GetElementType(int i) const {
01426     assert(i < (int)elementTypes.size());
01427     // If the struct is uniform qualified, then each member comes out with
01428     // the same type as in the original source file.  If it's varying, then
01429     // all members are promoted to varying.
01430     const Type *ret = isUniform ? elementTypes[i] : 
01431         elementTypes[i]->GetAsVaryingType();
01432     return isConst ? ret->GetAsConstType() : ret;
01433 }
01434 
01435 
01436 const Type *
01437 StructType::GetElementType(const std::string &n) const {
01438     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elementNames.size(); ++i)
01439         if (elementNames[i] == n) {
01440             const Type *ret = isUniform ? elementTypes[i] : 
01441                 elementTypes[i]->GetAsVaryingType();
01442             return isConst ? ret->GetAsConstType() : ret;
01443         }
01444     return NULL;
01445 }
01446 
01447 
01448 int
01449 StructType::GetElementNumber(const std::string &n) const {
01450     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < elementNames.size(); ++i)
01451         if (elementNames[i] == n)
01452             return i;
01453     return -1;
01454 }

01550 
01551 std::string
01552 ReferenceType::GetString() const {
01553     std::string ret;
01554     if (isConst || targetType->IsConstType())
01555         ret += "const ";
01556     ret += std::string("reference<") + targetType->GetAsNonConstType()->GetString() + 
01557         std::string(">");
01558     return ret;
01559 }
01560 
01561 
01562 std::string
01563 ReferenceType::Mangle() const {
01564     std::string ret;
01565     if (isConst)
01566         ret += "C";
01567     ret += std::string("REF") + targetType->Mangle();
01568     return ret;
01569 }
01570 
01571 
01572 std::string
01573 ReferenceType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &name) const {
01574     const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(targetType);
01575     if (at != NULL) {
01576         if (at->GetElementCount() == 0) {
01577             // emit unsized arrays as pointers to the base type..
01578             std::string ret;
01579             if (isConst || at->GetElementType()->IsConstType())
01580                 ret += "const ";
01581             ret += at->GetElementType()->GetAsNonConstType()->GetCDeclaration("") + 
01582                 std::string(" *");
01583             if (lShouldPrintName(name))
01584                 ret += name;
01585             return ret;
01586         }
01587         else
01588             // otherwise forget about the reference part if it's an
01589             // array since C already passes arrays by reference...
01590             return targetType->GetCDeclaration(name);
01591     }
01592     else {
01593         std::string ret;
01594         if (isConst || targetType->IsConstType())
01595             ret += "const ";
01596         ret += targetType->GetAsNonConstType()->GetCDeclaration("") + 
01597             std::string(" *");
01598         if (lShouldPrintName(name))
01599             ret += name;
01600         return ret;
01601     }
01602 }
01603 
01604 
01605 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *
01606 ReferenceType::LLVMType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx) const {
01607     if (!targetType)
01608         return NULL;
01609     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *t = targetType->LLVMType(ctx);
01610     if (!t)
01611         return NULL;
01612     return llvm::PointerType::get(t, 0);
01613 }
01614 
01615 
01616 llvm::DIType
01617 ReferenceType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
01618 #ifdef LLVM_2_8
01619     FATAL("debug info not supported in llvm 2.8");
01620     return llvm::DIType();
01621 #else
01622     llvm::DIType diTargetType = targetType->GetDIType(scope);
01623     return m->diBuilder->createReferenceType(diTargetType);
01624 #endif // LLVM_2_8
01625 }

01717 
01718 std::string
01719 FunctionType::GetString() const {
01720     std::string ret;
01721     if (isTask) ret += "task ";
01722     ret += returnType->GetString();
01723     ret += "(";
01724     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
01725         ret += argTypes[i]->GetString();
01726         if (i != argTypes.size() - 1)
01727             ret += ", ";
01728     }
01729     ret += ")";
01730     return ret;
01731 }
01732 
01733 
01734 std::string
01735 FunctionType::Mangle() const {
01736     std::string ret = "___";
01737     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i)
01738         ret += argTypes[i]->Mangle();
01739     return ret;
01740 }
01741 
01742 
01743 std::string
01744 FunctionType::GetCDeclaration(const std::string &fname) const {
01745     std::string ret;
01746     ret += returnType->GetCDeclaration("");
01747     ret += " ";
01748     ret += fname;
01749     ret += "(";
01750     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
01751         if (argNames.size())
01752             ret += argTypes[i]->GetCDeclaration(argNames[i]);
01753         else
01754             ret += argTypes[i]->GetString();
01755         if (i != argTypes.size() - 1)
01756             ret += ", ";
01757     }
01758     ret += ")";
01759     return ret;
01760 }

01765     FATAL("FunctionType::LLVMType() shouldn't be called");
01766     return NULL;
01767 }

01770 llvm::DIType
01771 FunctionType::GetDIType(llvm::DIDescriptor scope) const {
01772     // @todo need to implement FunctionType::GetDIType()
01773     FATAL("need to implement FunctionType::GetDIType()");
01774     return llvm::DIType();
01775 }
01776 
01777 
01778 const llvm::FunctionType *
01779 FunctionType::LLVMFunctionType(llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, bool includeMask) const {
01780     if (!includeMask && isTask) {
01781         Error(pos, "Function can't have both \"task\" and \"export\" qualifiers");
01782         return NULL;
01783     }
01784 
01785     // Get the LLVM Type *s for the function arguments
01786     std::vector<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *> llvmArgTypes;
01787     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
01788         if (!argTypes[i])
01789             return NULL;
01790 
01791         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *t = argTypes[i]->LLVMType(ctx);
01792         if (!t)
01793             return NULL;
01794         llvmArgTypes.push_back(t);
01795     }
01796 
01797     // And add the function mask, if asked for
01798     if (includeMask)
01799         llvmArgTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::MaskType);
01800 
01801     std::vector<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *> callTypes;
01802     if (isTask) {
01803         // Tasks take three arguments: a pointer to a struct that holds the
01804         // actual task arguments, the thread index, and the total number of
01805         // threads the tasks system has running.  (Task arguments are
01806         // marshalled in a struct so that it's easy to allocate space to
01807         // hold them until the task actually runs.)
01808         llvm::Type *st = llvm::StructType::get(*ctx, llvmArgTypes);
01809         callTypes.push_back(llvm::PointerType::getUnqual(st));
01810         callTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32Type); // threadIndex
01811         callTypes.push_back(LLVMTypes::Int32Type); // threadCount
01812     }
01813     else
01814         // Otherwise we already have the types of the arguments 
01815         callTypes = llvmArgTypes;
01816 
01817     return llvm::FunctionType::get(returnType->LLVMType(g->ctx), callTypes, false);
01818 }
01819 
01820 
01821 void
01822 FunctionType::SetArgumentDefaults(const std::vector<ConstExpr *> &d) const {
01823     assert(argDefaults.size() == 0);
01824     assert(d.size() == argTypes.size());
01825     argDefaults = d;
01826 }

01828 
01829 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01830 // Type
01831 
01832 const Type *
01833 Type::GetReferenceTarget() const {
01834     // only ReferenceType needs to override this method
01835     return this;
01836 }
01837 
01838 
01839 const Type *
01840 Type::GetAsUnsignedType() const {
01841     // For many types, this doesn't make any sesne
01842     return NULL;
01843 }
01844 
01845 
01846 /** Given an atomic or vector type, return a vector type of the given
01847     vecSize.  Issue an error if given a vector type that isn't already that
01848     size.
01849  */
01850 static const Type *
01851 lVectorConvert(const Type *type, SourcePos pos, const char *reason, int vecSize) {
01852     const VectorType *vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type);
01853     if (vt) {
01854         if (vt->GetElementCount() != vecSize) {
01855             Error(pos, "Implicit conversion between from vector type "
01856                   "\"%s\" to vector type of length %d for %s is not possible.", 
01857                   type->GetString().c_str(), vecSize, reason);
01858             return NULL;
01859         }
01860         return vt;
01861     }
01862     else {
01863         const AtomicType *at = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type);
01864         if (!at) {
01865             Error(pos, "Non-atomic type \"%s\" can't be converted to vector type "
01866                   "for %s.", type->GetString().c_str(), reason);
01867             return NULL;
01868         }
01869         return new VectorType(at, vecSize);
01870     }
01871 }
01872 
01873 
01874 const Type *
01875 Type::MoreGeneralType(const Type *t0, const Type *t1, SourcePos pos, const char *reason, 
01876                       bool forceVarying, int vecSize) {
01877     assert(reason != NULL);
01878 
01879     // First, if we need to go varying, promote both of the types to be
01880     // varying.
01881     if (t0->IsVaryingType() || t1->IsVaryingType() || forceVarying) {
01882         t0 = t0->GetAsVaryingType();
01883         t1 = t1->GetAsVaryingType();
01884     }
01885 
01886     // And similarly, promote them both to vectors if the caller requested
01887     // a particular vector size
01888     if (vecSize > 0) {
01889         t0 = lVectorConvert(t0, pos, reason, vecSize);
01890         t1 = lVectorConvert(t1, pos, reason, vecSize);
01891         if (!t0 || !t1)
01892             return NULL;
01893     }
01894 
01895     // Are they both the same type?  If so, we're done, QED.
01896     if (Type::Equal(t0, t1)) 
01897         return t0;
01898 
01899     // Not the same types, but only a const/non-const difference?  Return
01900     // the non-const type as the more general one.
01901     if (Type::Equal(t0->GetAsConstType(), t1->GetAsConstType()))
01902         return t0->GetAsNonConstType();
01903 
01904     const VectorType *vt0 = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(t0);
01905     const VectorType *vt1 = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(t1);
01906     if (vt0 && vt1) {
01907         // both are vectors; convert their base types and make a new vector
01908         // type, as long as their lengths match
01909         if (vt0->GetElementCount() != vt1->GetElementCount()) {
01910             Error(pos, "Implicit conversion between differently sized vector types "
01911                   "(%s, %s) for %s is not possible.", t0->GetString().c_str(),
01912                   t1->GetString().c_str(), reason);
01913             return NULL;
01914         }
01915         const Type *t = MoreGeneralType(vt0->GetElementType(), vt1->GetElementType(),
01916                                         pos, reason, forceVarying);
01917         if (!t) 
01918             return NULL;
01919 
01920         // The 'more general' version of the two vector element types must
01921         // be an AtomicType (that's all that vectors can hold...)
01922         const AtomicType *at = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(t);
01923         assert(at != NULL);
01924 
01925         return new VectorType(at, vt0->GetElementCount());
01926     }
01927     else if (vt0) {
01928         // If one type is a vector type but the other isn't, see if we can
01929         // promote the other one to a vector type.  This will fail and
01930         // return NULL if t1 is e.g. an array type and it's illegal to have
01931         // a vector of it..
01932         const Type *t = MoreGeneralType(vt0->GetElementType(), t1, pos, 
01933                                         reason, forceVarying);
01934         if (!t) 
01935             return NULL;
01936 
01937         const AtomicType *at = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(t);
01938         assert(at != NULL);
01939         return new VectorType(at, vt0->GetElementCount());
01940     }
01941     else if (vt1) {
01942         // As in the above case, see if we can promote t0 to make a vector
01943         // that matches vt1.
01944         const Type *t = MoreGeneralType(t0, vt1->GetElementType(), pos, 
01945                                         reason, forceVarying);
01946         if (!t) 
01947             return NULL;
01948 
01949         const AtomicType *at = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(t);
01950         assert(at != NULL);
01951         return new VectorType(at, vt1->GetElementCount());
01952     }
01953 
01954     // TODO: what do we need to do about references here, if anything??
01955 
01956     const AtomicType *at0 = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(t0->GetReferenceTarget());
01957     const AtomicType *at1 = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(t1->GetReferenceTarget());
01958 
01959     const EnumType *et0 = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(t0->GetReferenceTarget());
01960     const EnumType *et1 = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(t1->GetReferenceTarget());
01961     if (et0 != NULL && et1 != NULL) {
01962         // Two different enum types -> make them uint32s...
01963         assert(et0->IsVaryingType() == et1->IsVaryingType());
01964         return et0->IsVaryingType() ? AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 :
01965                 AtomicType::UniformUInt32;
01966     }
01967     else if (et0 != NULL) {
01968         if (at1 != NULL)
01969             // Enum type and atomic type -> convert the enum to the atomic type
01970             // TODO: should we return uint32 here, unless the atomic type is
01971             // a 64-bit atomic type, in which case we return that?
01972             return at1;
01973         else {
01974             Error(pos, "Implicit conversion from enum type \"%s\" to "
01975                   "non-atomic type \"%s\" for %s not possible.",
01976                   t0->GetString().c_str(), t1->GetString().c_str(), reason);
01977             return NULL;
01978         }
01979     }
01980     else if (et1 != NULL) {
01981         if (at0 != NULL)
01982             // Enum type and atomic type; see TODO above here as well...
01983             return at0;
01984         else {
01985             Error(pos, "Implicit conversion from enum type \"%s\" to "
01986                   "non-atomic type \"%s\" for %s not possible.",
01987                   t1->GetString().c_str(), t0->GetString().c_str(), reason);
01988             return NULL;
01989         }
01990     }
01991 
01992     // Now all we can do is promote atomic types...
01993     if (at0 == NULL || at1 == NULL) {
01994         assert(reason != NULL);
01995         Error(pos, "Implicit conversion from type \"%s\" to \"%s\" for %s not possible.",
01996               t0->GetString().c_str(), t1->GetString().c_str(), reason);
01997         return NULL;
01998     }
01999 
02000     // Finally, to determine which of the two atomic types is more general,
02001     // use the ordering of entries in the AtomicType::BasicType enumerator.
02002     return (int(at0->basicType) >= int(at1->basicType)) ? at0 : at1;
02003 }
02004 
02005 
02006 bool
02007 Type::Equal(const Type *a, const Type *b) {
02008     if (a == NULL || b == NULL)
02009         return false;
02010 
02011     // We can compare AtomicTypes with pointer equality, since the
02012     // AtomicType constructor is private so that there isonly the single
02013     // canonical instance of the AtomicTypes (AtomicType::UniformInt32,
02014     // etc.)
02015     if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(a) != NULL &&
02016         dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(b) != NULL)
02017         return a == b;
02018 
02019     // For all of the other types, we need to see if we have the same two
02020     // general types.  If so, then we dig into the details of the type and
02021     // see if all of the relevant bits are equal...
02022     const EnumType *eta = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(a);
02023     const EnumType *etb = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(b);
02024     if (eta != NULL && etb != NULL)
02025         // Kind of goofy, but this sufficies to check
02026         return (eta->pos == etb->pos &&
02027                 eta->IsUniformType() == etb->IsUniformType() &&
02028                 eta->IsConstType() == etb->IsConstType());
02029 
02030     const ArrayType *ata = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(a);
02031     const ArrayType *atb = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(b);
02032     if (ata != NULL && atb != NULL)
02033         return (ata->GetElementCount() == atb->GetElementCount() && 
02034                 Equal(ata->GetElementType(), atb->GetElementType()));
02035 
02036     const VectorType *vta = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(a);
02037     const VectorType *vtb = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(b);
02038     if (vta != NULL && vtb != NULL)
02039         return (vta->GetElementCount() == vtb->GetElementCount() && 
02040                 Equal(vta->GetElementType(), vtb->GetElementType()));
02041 
02042     const StructType *sta = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(a);
02043     const StructType *stb = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(b);
02044     if (sta != NULL && stb != NULL) {
02045         if (sta->GetElementCount() != stb->GetElementCount())
02046             return false;
02047         for (int i = 0; i < sta->GetElementCount(); ++i)
02048             if (!Equal(sta->GetElementType(i), stb->GetElementType(i)))
02049                 return false;
02050         return true;
02051     }
02052 
02053     const ReferenceType *rta = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(a);
02054     const ReferenceType *rtb = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(b);
02055     if (rta != NULL && rtb != NULL)
02056         return Type::Equal(rta->GetReferenceTarget(),
02057                            rtb->GetReferenceTarget());
02058 
02059     const FunctionType *fta = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(a);
02060     const FunctionType *ftb = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(b);
02061     if (fta != NULL && ftb != NULL) {
02062         // Both the return types and all of the argument types must match
02063         // for function types to match
02064         if (!Equal(fta->GetReturnType(), ftb->GetReturnType()))
02065             return false;
02066 
02067         const std::vector<const Type *> &aargs = fta->GetArgumentTypes();
02068         const std::vector<const Type *> &bargs = ftb->GetArgumentTypes();
02069         if (aargs.size() != bargs.size())
02070             return false;
02071         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < aargs.size(); ++i)
02072             if (!Equal(aargs[i], bargs[i]))
02073                 return false;
02074         return true;
02075     }
02076 
02077     return false;
02078 }
